content.title: Credit Based Schemes For SC - Education Loan Scheme
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: Education loan scheme by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment for Scheduled Caste students pursuing full-time Professional/Technical courses in India or abroad. This scheme is for providing financial assistance in pursuing full-time Professional/Technical courses.
benefits: Financial Assistance up to 90% of the Course Fee or Rs.10.00 Lakhs for students within India.
Financial Assistance up to 90% of the Course Fee or Rs.20.00 Lakhs for students studying abroad.
Interest rate of 4% (3.5% for women beneficiaries).
Repayment period up to 10 years for loans up to Rs.7.50 lakh and up to 15 years for loans above Rs.7.50 lakh.
Moratorium period of 6 months after course completion or getting employment, whichever is earlier.
eligibility: Students of the Scheduled Caste Category.
Annual family income up to Rs. 3.00 Lakhs.
content.application_process: The interested eligible person shall contact the nearest Channeling Agency.

faqs.question: What is moratorium period?
faqs.answer: A moratorium period refers to a particular period of a loan tenure during which the borrower does not have to repay anything. It can be described as a waiting period before the borrower will have to start paying the equated monthly installments (EMIs) for his or her loan.

faqs.question: Does the scheme provide loans to all Scheduled Castes persons?
faqs.answer: No, NSFDC provides loans only to economically poor sections of Scheduled Castes whose annual family income is up to Rs. 3.00 lakh both in rural & urban areas.

faqs.question: How does the scheme provide assistance?
faqs.answer: The applicants should contact the Channelizing Agencies if they wish to avail ELS loan.

faqs.question: For which Educational courses, the Educational Loan is provided?
faqs.answer: The Educational Loan is provided for the courses run by the recognized Educational Institutions. Presently, it is provided for pursuing full-time professional/technical courses in various fields.
